articles.description:
Learn how to identify, understand, attack, and remediate SMB shares configured with excessive privilege in active directory environments with the help of new charts, graphs, and LLM capabilities.
The post Hunting SMB Shares, Again! Charts, Graphs, Passwords & LLM Magic for PowerHuntShares 2.0 appeared first on NetSPI.
articles.title: Hunting SMB Shares, Again! Charts, Graphs, Passwords & LLM Magic for PowerHuntShares 2.0

articles.author: Thomas Elling
articles.description:
Learn how attackers can escalate privileges in Cloud Composer by exploiting the dedicated Cloud Storage Bucket and the risks of default configurations.
The post Filling up the DagBag: Privilege Escalation in Google Cloud Composer appeared first on NetSPI.
articles.title: Filling up the DagBag: Privilege Escalation in Google Cloud Composer

articles.title: How an Information Disclosure Vulnerability Led to Critical Data Exposure

articles.author: Dmitry Janushkevich
articles.description:
The WolfBox E40 is a Level 2 electric vehicle charge station designed for residential home use. Its hardware has a minimal user interface, providing a Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) interface for configuration and an NFC reader for user authentication. Typical for this class of devices, the appliance employs a mobile application for the owner's installation and regular operation of the equipment.
At the moment of writing, the software versions were reported as follows:
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Main module: 3.1.17
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† MCU module: 1.2.6
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Mobile application: 1.0.3
WolfBox EV Mobile Application
The manufacturer distributes one application to configure and maintain the device. The application, named WolfBox EV, is available for both Android and iOS users.
Figure 1 - Application Start Screen
Interestingly, t‚Ä¶
articles.title: Detailing the Attack Surfaces of the WolfBox E40 EV Charger

articles.author: Connor Ford
articles.description:
In our previous Kenwood DMX958XR blog post, we detailed the internals of the Kenwood in-vehicle infotainment (IVI) head unit and provided annotated pictures of each PCB. In this post, we aim to outline the attack surface of the DMX958XR in the hopes of providing inspiration for vulnerability research. 
We will cover the main supported technologies that present potential attack surfaces, such as USB, Bluetooth, Android Auto, Apple CarPlay, Kenwood apps, and more. We also provide a list of the open-source components the DMX958XR claims to use. 
All information has been obtained through reverse engineering, experimenting, and combing through the following resources: 
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Kenwood DMX958XR Product Page
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Kenwood DMX958XR Instruction Manual [PDF] 
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Kenwood DMX958XR Quick Start Guid‚Ä¶
articles.title: Looking at the Attack Surfaces of the Kenwood DMX958XR IVI

articles.author: Connor Ford
articles.description:
For the upcoming Pwn2Own Automotive contest, a total of four in-vehicle infotainment (IVI) head units have been selected as targets. One of these is the double DIN Kenwood DMX958XR. This unit offers a variety of functionality, such as wired and wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay, as well as USB media playback, wireless mirroring, and more. 
This blog post presents internal photos of the DMX958XR boards and highlights each of the interesting components. A hidden debugging interface is also detailed which can be leveraged to obtain a root shell.
Internals
The DMX958XR is a compact unit that contains multiple interconnected boards. Fortunately, the most interesting board is at the top of the unit and can be easily accessed by removing a few screws and metal plates.
The topside of the mai‚Ä¶
articles.title: Looking at the Internals of the Kenwood DMX958XR IVI

articles.author: Dustin Childs
articles.description:
It‚Äôs not quite the holiday season, despite what some early decorators will have you believe. It is the second Tuesday of the month, and that means Adobe and Microsoft have released their regularly scheduled updates. Take a break from your regular activities and join us as we review the details of their latest security alerts.If you‚Äôd rather watch the full video recap covering the entire release, you can check it out here:
Adobe Patches for November 2024
For November, Adobe released eight patches addressing 48 CVEs in Adobe Bridge, Audition, After Effects, Substance 3D Painter, Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, and Commerce. The largest of these fixes is for Substance 3D Painter with 22 Critical and Important CVEs. The next largest is the patch for Illustrator, with nine CVEs addressed. The‚Ä¶
articles.title: The November 2024 Security Update Review

articles.author: Dmitry Janushkevich
articles.description:
Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Mazda Connect Connectivity Master Unit (CMU) system installed in multiple car models, such as the Mazda 3 model year 2014-2021. Like in so many cases, these vulnerabilities are caused by insufficient sanitization when handling attacker-supplied input. A physically present attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by connecting a specially crafted USB device ‚Äì such as an iPod or mass storage device ‚Äì to the target system. Successful exploitation of some of these vulnerabilities results in arbitrary code execution with root privileges.
The Target
The specific CMU unit that was the target of the research was manufactured by Visteon, while the software was initially developed by Johnson Controls Inc (JCI). The research was performed again‚Ä¶
articles.title: Multiple Vulnerabilities in the Mazda In-Vehicle Infotainment (IVI) System

articles.author: R.Rivera
articles.description: We‚Äôre excited to announce that all of NCC Group‚Äôs latest research findings and articles are now hosted on our website at the following link: NCC Group Research Blog. (https://www.nccgroup.com/us/research-blog/) To stay up-to-date with our latest research, you can also subscribe to our RSS feed here: NCC Group Research Blog RSS Feed. (https://www.nccgroup.com/us/research-blog/feed/) Be sure to [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: New website address and RSS Feed

articles.author: Harry Hayward
articles.description:
In the world of wireless communications, security vulnerabilities in implemented protocols canremain hidden behind layers of complexity. What appears secure due to the intricate nature ofRF communications may harbor fundamental weaknesses. Let‚Äôs dive into a fascinating casethat reveals how a seemingly minor cryptographic weakness in frequency hopping algorithmscan compromise an entire wireless communication stream. Understanding [‚Ä¶]
The post RF Fortune Telling: Frequency Hopping Predictability appeared first on Praetorian.
articles.title: RF Fortune Telling: Frequency Hopping Predictability

articles.author: Kenneth King
articles.description:
The Praetorian team recently discovered a new vulnerability in Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM) which serves as a reminder to be aware of legacy systems - patch regularly and test often.
The post Skeletons in the Closet: Legacy Software, Novel Exploits appeared first on Praetorian.
articles.title: Skeletons in the Closet: Legacy Software, Novel Exploits

articles.author: John De Armas
articles.description: The post CloudGoat Official Walkthrough Series: ‚Äòsqs_flag_shop‚Äô appeared first on Rhino Security Labs.
articles.title: CloudGoat Official Walkthrough Series: ‚Äòsqs_flag_shop‚Äô

articles.description:
Doyensec‚Äôs Maxence Schmitt recently built a
playground to go with his
CSPT research. In this blog post, we will demonstrate how to find and exploit CSPT bugs with Eval Villain. For this purpose, we will leverage the second challenge of Maxence‚Äôs playground.
A step-by-step intro to CSPT with Eval Villain
The next image shows what this methodology yields.



We‚Äôve added some boxes and arrows in orange to better illustrate the current situation. First,
Eval Villain saw that part of the page‚Äôs path is being used in a fetch request.
There, you can plainly see the asdf%2f.. was being URL decoded. Or if you prefer, you can expanded
the ‚ÄúEncoder function‚Äù group to check. Either way, Eval Villain had discovered the CSPT sink.
The second square is on top of a debug statement from evSourcer. This was‚Ä¶
articles.title: CSPT the Eval Villain Way!

articles.author: Trail of Bits
articles.description: By Artem Dinaburg AI-enabled code assistants (like GitHub‚Äôs Copilot, Continue.dev, and Tabby) are making software development faster and more productive. Unfortunately, these tools are often bad at Solidity. So we decided to improve them! To make it easier to write, edit, and understand Solidity with AI-enabled tools, we have: Added support for Solidity into Tabby [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: Evaluating Solidity support in AI coding assistants

articles.author: William Woodruff
articles.description: Read the official announcement on the PyPI blog as well! For the past year, we‚Äôve worked with the Python Package Index (PyPI) on a new security feature for the Python ecosystem: index-hosted digital attestations, as specified in PEP 740. These attestations improve on traditional PGP signatures (which have been disabled on PyPI) by providing key [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: Attestations: A new generation of signatures on PyPI

articles.author: Trail of Bits
articles.description: By Simone Monica In January, we identified and reported a vulnerability in the Lotus and Venus clients of the Filecoin network that allowed an attacker to remotely crash a node and trigger a denial of service. This issue is caused by an incorrect validation of an index, resulting in an index out-of-range panic. The vulnerability [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: Killing Filecoin nodes

articles.author: Exodus Intel VRT
articles.description:
By Luca Ginex Overview This post discusses CVE-2024-38193, a use-after-free vulnerability in the afd.sys Windows driver. Specifically, the vulnerability is in the Registered I/O extension for Windows sockets. The vulnerability was patched in the August 2024 Patch Tuesday. This post describes the exploitation process for the vulnerability. First, we give a general overview of the ... Read more Windows Sockets: From Registered I/O to SYSTEM Privileges
The post Windows Sockets: From Registered I/O to SYSTEM Privileges appeared first on Exodus Intelligence.
articles.title: Windows Sockets: From Registered I/O to SYSTEM Privileges

articles.author: Andy Gill
articles.description: This post explores Windows Side-by-Side (WinSxS) and DLL hijacking, deep-diving some tooling I've written and some of the fun along the way.
articles.title: Side-by-Side with HelloJackHunter: Unveiling the Mysteries of WinSxS

articles.author: Amr Essam
articles.description:
AWS has launched a feature that allows a single security group to be associated with multiple VPCs and shared across AWS accounts within the same organization. These updates facilitate the centralized management of security group rules, ensuring consistent traffic control across various VPCs and accounts.
Source
articles.title: AWS security group VPC associations and security group sharing

articles.author: Michael Pietroforte
articles.description:
A warning is circulating on social media regarding Microsoft utilizing customer data from its Microsoft 365 applications‚Äîsuch as Word, Excel, and Outlook‚Äîfor training its AI models. Microsoft has addressed these concerns on X and Bluesky, which seems to have reassured most journalists who reported on the incident across various news platforms. Nonetheless, I highly advise disabling all "connected experiences that analyze your content" in your Office apps or for your entire organization via Group Policy.
Source
articles.title: Disable connected experiences that analyze your content in Microsoft 365 (MS Office)

articles.author: Markus Elsberger
articles.description:
Hotpatching in Windows Server 2025 allows admins to apply critical updates without restarting the system. Hotpatching is available in the Standard and Datacenter editions of Windows Server 2025. It can be used in on-premises environments, the Azure cloud, or virtual servers with VMware or Hyper-V, provided that Virtualization-Based Security (VBS) is supported.
Source
articles.title: Enable Windows Server 2025 Hotpatching

articles.author: Baki Onur Okutucu
articles.description:
Microsoft announced the public preview of VM watch, a new in-VM service designed for Azure Virtual Machines (VMs) and Virtual Machine Scale Sets (VMSS). This service aims to enhance VM health monitoring by offering standardized, lightweight, and flexible in-VM health checks that connect seamlessly with Azure's monitoring and AIOps systems.
Source
articles.title: Install and manage VM watch on Azure Virtual Machines

articles.author: Surender Kumar
articles.description:
In an earlier post, I explored the features introduced in Docker Desktop 4.34. Here, I‚Äôll delve into what‚Äôs new in Docker Desktop 4.35.
Source
articles.title: Docker Desktop 4.35: Organization Access Tokens, Volumes Export, Integrated Terminal, Docker VMM on macOS, RHEL Support, Docker Home

articles.author: Wolfgang Sommergut
articles.description:
With Windows 11 23H2, the Local Administrator Password Solution (LAPS) became integrated into the OS, and 24H2 brings several interesting new features. These features include the automatic management of local admin accounts, the implementation of passphrases, and the automatic generation of a new password following a computer reset.
Source
articles.title: LAPS: Automatically create local admin accounts, use passphrases, activate rollback detection

articles.author: Michael Pietroforte
articles.description:
In May 2024, Microsoft introduced the Windows Recall, which captures screenshots of user activity. Following significant criticism over privacy and security concerns, its rollout faced multiple delays. Microsoft has now reintroduced Recall in the latest Windows 11 Insider Preview, making it available to Windows Insiders in the Dev Channel who use Copilot Plus PCs equipped with Qualcomm‚Äôs Snapdragon X series processors. Its reinstatement raises fresh concerns about whether such intrusive technology should exist at all, given its potential for misuse and privacy concerns.
Source
articles.title: Windows Recall: A helpful assitant for forgetful users or a security and privacy nightmare?

articles.author: Michael Pietroforte
articles.description:
Microsoft is enhancing Windows 11‚Äôs authentication capabilities by updating the Web Authentication API (WebAuthn) to support third-party passkey providers, which can work alongside Windows Hello to leverage biometric methods and public key cryptography, aligning with the FIDO2 standard for passwordless authentication.
Source
articles.title: Windows 11 passkey support for third-party providers

articles.author: Vignesh Mudliar
articles.description:
Microsoft Entra Private Access aims to replace traditional Virtual Private Networks (VPNs) while significantly enhancing security. Employing conditional access policies provides a more secure way to access private resources, ensuring only authorized users can connect to sensitive data and applications. In this blog, you will learn the critical features of Entra Private Access, how to configure it, and how to implement it together with conditional access policies.
Source
articles.title: Microsoft Entra Private Access: Replacing VPN

articles.author: Baki Onur Okutucu
articles.description:
Azure Copilot, now in preview, introduces AI capabilities to streamline tasks across the Azure platform. Given that Copilot can execute substantial actions within Azure, limiting access to authorized administrators is essential. This responsibility mainly falls on Global Administrators (GAs) in Microsoft Entra ID. The following is a step-by-step guide for managing Azure Copilot access through PowerShell to ensure secure and controlled usage.
Source
articles.title: Restrict access to Microsoft Copilot in Azure with PowerShell

articles.author: Edem Afenyo
articles.description:
Microsoft has recently enhanced Windows Sandbox, a feature that allows users to run applications in an isolated environment which enables you to safely test applications.
Source
articles.title: New Windows Sandbox: Configuration options with GUI and CLI

articles.author: Wolfgang Sommergut
articles.description:
Six months ago, Broadcom made VMware Workstation and Fusion available free for private use. Now, the company has extended this offer to include free professional use. However, downloading the software from Broadcom's website remains challenging.
Source
articles.title: Download VMware Workstation and Fusion for free

articles.author: Jasmin Kahriman
articles.description:
Sysinternals Process Monitor is a sophisticated, free Microsoft tool for real-time monitoring of file systems, processes, threat activity, and the registry. It combines the features of two older Sysinternals utilities, Filemon and Regmon while introducing a wide range of enhancements. Microsoft has launched Process Monitor version 4.01, improving the user interface, upgrading performance, adding new functionalities, and fixing bugs.
Source
articles.title: Download Sysinternals Process Monitor 4.01: Process timestamp, new filter, event count occurrences

articles.author: Robert Pearman
articles.description: In my latest article, I demonstrated how to use PowerAutomate to send SMS messages. I briefly mentioned that you can also receive SMS messages in Microsoft Teams, and in this article, I will outline a straightforward method for doing so.
articles.title: Receive SMS messages in Microsoft Teams

articles.author: Wolfgang Sommergut
articles.description: Windows Server 2025 introduces new pricing and licensing options, with notable updates to the Standard and Datacenter editions. License fees have increased by 10 to 20 percent.
articles.title: Windows Server 2025 pricing and licensing options

articles.author: Markus Elsberger
articles.description: The Windows Package Manager Winget is now included in Windows Server 2025. In this guide, I will demonstrate how to use Winget to search for, install, update, and uninstall apps on Windows Server 2025.
articles.title: Use Winget on Windows Server 2025 to install, update, and uninstall apps

articles.author: Markus Elsberger
articles.description: Windows Server 2025 comes with SSH pre-installed, making secure remote server management easier for administrators. This is especially helpful when accessing servers from macOS or Linux machines or Windows computers not part of the Active Directory domain, as enabling PowerShell remoting can be complicated in this scenario. By default, SSH on Windows Server 2025 uses password authentication, which you should change to public key authentication for enhanced security.
articles.title: Install and enable SSH on Windows Server 2025

articles.author: Leos Marek
articles.description: Windows applications display toast notifications in the bottom-right corner of the screen and the Action Center. Using the BurntToast PowerShell module, you can effortlessly send toast notifications from your scripts, incorporating data from various sources like ticketing systems or other applications.
articles.title: Generate Windows toast notifications with the PowerShell module BurntToast

articles.author: Vignesh Mudliar
articles.description: Microsoft Entra tokens are digital credentials issued by Microsoft Entra ID (formerly Azure Active Directory) to authenticate users and authorize access to protected resources within an organization‚Äôs environment. In this post, you'll gain insights into the various type of token thefts, including how they occur and their implications for your organization. By understanding these threats, you can better equip your security measures to protect valuable information and maintain the integrity of your systems.
articles.title: How to prevent token theft using the new Token protection conditional access policy in Microsoft Entra

articles.author: Wolfgang Sommergut
articles.description: When a user launches the Edge browser for the first time on a PC, the welcome page (also known as the "first-run experience") automatically launches a wizard. It guides the users through various settings. You can hide this page in managed environments and configure the respective settings through Group Policy.
articles.title: Hide the first-run page in Microsoft Edge, configure setting with GPO

articles.author: Brandon Lee
articles.description: Mobile Device Management (MDM) is now a critical focus for IT administrators, providing essential tools to manage user endpoints centrally, ensuring they remain secure and up-to-date in a hybrid workforce. Pulseway 9.9 has just launched, introducing a new range of MDM features and automation enhancements.
articles.title: Pulseway 9.9 remote monitoring and management with new Mobile Device Management

articles.author: Mercy Bassey
articles.description: OpenSSH 9.9 is now available. It features security enhancements, the discontinuation of DSA support, and, notably, a new hybrid post-quantum key exchange designed to protect data exchange against potential threats from classical and quantum computing.
articles.title: OpenSSH 9.9 new features: Enhanced security with post-quantum key exchange (mlkem768x25519-sha256) and DSA removal

articles.author: adam
articles.description: The ShellExec_RunDLL API is now exposed by both shell32.dll and windows.storage.dll. It is not the only curiosity about this function. Analysing its code one can discover that is accepts a secret command line argument. If we provide a question mark ‚Ä¶ Continue reading ‚Üí
articles.title: 1 little known secret of ShellExec_RunDLL

articles.author: adam
articles.description: In my last post I have shown that some of the shell32.dll functions are now mapped to windows.storage.dll. This sort of API mapping, as well as blatant code redundancy present in many Windows binaries is not new, and we have ‚Ä¶ Continue reading ‚Üí
articles.title: Mapping the API mapping/code redundancy

articles.author: adam
articles.description: This is a bit surprising, but the recent versions of windows.storage.dll export a number of functions identical with shell32.dll. In fact, shell32.dll imports these windows.storage.dll functions and is basically forwarding the execution to them, and just acting as a proxy. ‚Ä¶ Continue reading ‚Üí
articles.title: Windows.Storage.lol

articles.author: adam
articles.description: This a weird post; it doesn‚Äôt give many answers and it pretty much focuses on describing results of a simple task of data hoarding‚Ä¶ When people think of a ‚Äòbrowser‚Äô they usually think of a software like Chrome, Safari, Firefox, ‚Ä¶ Continue reading ‚Üí
articles.title: Browsing the browsers

articles.author: adam
articles.description: Many people believe that native Windows programs are so deeply integrated with OS that there is no way to move them between these different OS versions. And it‚Äôs fair to say that at first this belief was reinforced by that ‚Ä¶ Continue reading ‚Üí
articles.title: Portability of old Windows programs‚Ä¶

articles.author: adam
articles.description: Debugging Service Processes on Windows is a bit tricky ‚Äì the old IFO / Debugger trick doesn‚Äôt work anymore, because services run in their own session. Also, when you attempt to debug a service process by attaching your debugger to ‚Ä¶ Continue reading ‚Üí
articles.title: How to debug Windows service processes in the most old-school possible way‚Ä¶

articles.author: adam
articles.description: Sometimes ‚Äòresearch‚Äô means browsing the folders of the ‚Äòinstalled ‚Äòtarget‚Äô and‚Ä¶ just executing programs present inside these directories to see what they do. During this very engaging and fascinating activity I noticed that the program: c:\Program Files (x86)\Adobe\Acrobat Reader DC\Reader\OSSLLibs\AdobeFips.exe ‚Ä¶ Continue reading ‚Üí
articles.title: AdobeFips ‚Äì Adobe Reader Lolbin

articles.author: adam
articles.description: The Acrobat Reader is a very popular software installed on millions of computers worldwide. Today I noticed that anytime AcroRd32.exe program starts (tested with the latest version 24.4) it checks the following folder: c:\Program Files (x86)\Adobe\Acrobat Reader DC\Reader\plug_ins\Test_Tools\ looking for ‚Ä¶ Continue reading ‚Üí
articles.title: Beyond good ol‚Äô Run key, Part 144

articles.author: adam
articles.description: I originally wrote this bit in 2016 and posted it on my (now no longer existing) personal blog. Over last 2 decades my wife and I moved quite often, pursuing better life, adventure, and most importantly, we were fulfilling our ‚Ä¶ Continue reading ‚Üí
